Data: Doherty to Smith, no run length on off, pushed to midwicket
Doherty to Smith, 1 run flighted on off, guided into the leg side for a single
Doherty to Kallis, no run flighted, middle and leg, turns, hits the edge, wide of keeper
Doherty to Kallis, no run more turn, but this time Kallis has it under control, guiding it to point
Doherty to Kallis, 3 runs quicker, fuller, down the leg, Kallis is quick to paddle it delicately, past the keeper, to the right of fine leg
Doherty to Smith, no run tossed up outside off, closes the face on it, to midwicket
Bollinger to Kallis, 1 run full toss outside off, driven to long-off
Bollinger to Smith, no run full and wide, holds its line, beats the outside edge. No feet here
Bollinger to Smith, no run jumps out, across, outside off, the ball is even wider, and beats the outside edge again

Bollinger to Smith, 1 run length ball outside off, crashes it to sweeper-cover to get to 50. He is feeling his way back to form, and the whole ground stands up and applauds. Smith takes time to acknowledge the support
Bollinger to Kallis, no run slower ball, outside off, looks to run it down, but early into the dab, bottom-edging it
Bollinger to Kallis, 1 run length ball, pushed to deepish mid-off for one
Doherty to Kallis, no run overpitched on off, pushed to cover
Doherty to Kallis, no run driven on the up, to extra cover

Doherty to Kallis, SIX runs this has got nothing to do with the way the ball is bowled. Kallis seemed t have made his mind he would hit a six over midwicket this ball. And he does. Goes on a knee, sweeps in front of square, a fullish ball, goes for a parallel and big six
Doherty to Kallis, FOUR runs this is slightly shorter, and grips and turns, but the outside edge beats both keeper and short third man
Doherty to Kallis, no run defended to cover this time
Doherty to Kallis, 1 run closes the face on this to take a single to square leg
Bollinger to Kallis, no run full and wide, driven straight to extra cover
Bollinger to Kallis, 1 run short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of short midwicket

Bollinger to Smith, FOUR runs that's his fourth boundary between mid-off and extra cover. This is an extraordinary innings from Smith. Leaves the crease, makes room, sends it crashing between the two men
Bollinger to Smith, 1 run this short ball chases him as he backs away, but he still manages a single to deep square
Bollinger to Smith, no run good yorker, 141ks, in front of off and middle, he digs it out well
Doherty to Kallis, no run more turn, this is flat too, pitches in front off and breaks away, beats the edge
Doherty to Kallis, no run even more turn, flat again, on off and middle, beats the drive, misses the off stump by inches. A slight puff of dust too
Doherty to Kallis, no run short of a length, on off, stays back to defend
Doherty to Kallis, 1 run paddled away from well outside off, moves away from the strike. It should be easier for Smith to face the left-arm spinner, who will bring the ball into him
Doherty to Smith, 1 run swept away from well outside off, gets a single to long leg
Doherty to Kallis, no run full, on off, hit back to the bowler

Smith to Smith, 4 byes beaten first ball. Smith is drawn out to play a really full delivery, misses it, but it goes between Haddin's legs. Nearly a yorker for him, so only a half chance for the stumping
Smith to Smith, no run tries the reverse sweep outside off, beaten
Smith to Smith, 1 run sweeps this square, all along the ground for one
Smith to Kallis, 1 run full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one

Smith to Smith, OUT Smith reviews this, Steven that is. Graeme has once again tried that cute reverse-sweep, misses, Haddin and Steven go up immediately. Umpire says no. Smith reviews immediately. The replays suggest a tiny little noise noise as the ball passes the glove, but there is no visual confirmation in normal replays.
Smith to Duminy, no run flighted outside off, Duminy is well outside off to defend it to cover
Doherty to Kallis, no run full, on off, defended off the front foot
Doherty to Kallis, no run short of a length, pushed to cover

Doherty to Kallis, 1 run, OUT more misjudgement from South Africa. After G Smith's too-cute-by-half reverse-sweep, Kallis has run himself out trying a cute second. Tries the paddle sweep, the top edge clears the keeper, but has hardly crossed the 30-yard circle. Clarke from slip runs back and fields and hits the stumps direct
Doherty to du Plessis, no run full, on the pads, defended to leg
Doherty to du Plessis, 1 run forces this square on the off side, past point, gets a single
Doherty to Duminy, no run tossed up outside off, presses forward to block it back to the bowler
Smith to du Plessis, no run defended solidly off the front foot
Smith to du Plessis, no run defended to cover
Smith to du Plessis, no run flat, quick, no turn, hits the pad
Smith to du Plessis, 1 run charges at him and drives, Warner gets a bad bounce at cover
Smith to Duminy, no run too full, hit back to the bowler
Smith to Duminy, no run tossed up outside off, holds its line, left alone
Doherty to du Plessis, no run defended to cover
Doherty to du Plessis, no run angled into the pads, defended to leg
Doherty to du Plessis, no run comes down the track, drives handsomely, can't beat cover
Doherty to du Plessis, FOUR runs more turn for Xman, this is flat and quick, takes the edge, and goes between keeper and slip. Fortunate runs
Doherty to du Plessis, no run nearly gets him again, slows this one down, Faff looks to play it to leg, gets a soft leading edge that goes nowhere
Doherty to du Plessis, no run quick on off, defended to cover
Smith to Duminy, 1 run clipped off the pads for a single
Smith to du Plessis, no run full, on the pads, flicked to midwicket
Smith to du Plessis, 1 run full, on the pad, clipped away for an easy single square on the on side
Smith to Duminy, no run lovely googly, Duminy has no clue about it and pushes forward, but what seems an edge has come off the back pad
Smith to Duminy, 1 run low full toss, swept away
Smith to du Plessis, 1 run turned around the corner for a single
Doherty to du Plessis, no run quick, full, on the pads, defended
Doherty to du Plessis, FOUR runs slower through the air, du Plessis comes down the track, right down to the pitch, drives it inside-out, and this time he also manages to beat cover
Doherty to du Plessis, no run slower through the air, pushes forward and efends
Doherty to du Plessis, no run flatter, quicker, pushed back to the bowler

Doherty to du Plessis, OUT he has walked past this one. This is superbly bowled. He jumps out of the crease again, Doherty gets a little bit of drift, a little of dip, which opens him up slightly. He is not close to the pitch now, and ends up feeling for the ball. It pitches one a length in front of leg, turns away, beats the
Doherty to Miller, 1 run moves across to the first ball he faces, sees it's short, stays back, and pushes it into the on side for a single
Smith to Miller, SIX runs Miller counterattacks. The second ball he faces. Comes down the track, right to the pitch of the ball, and smashes it for a parallel six over long-off
Smith to Miller, 1 run short on middle and leg, pulled away for one
Smith to Duminy, no run short of a length, middle and leg, defended to leg

Smith to Duminy, 4 byes We have a mystery bowler on our hands. Duminy Haddin and Clarke, all beaten. Full ball, outside off, goes straight on. Duminy misses the sweep. Haddin misses the collection. Clarke doesn't have enough time to get to his right
Smith to Duminy, no run leaves the crease with defence on his mind, pushing it back to Smith
Smith to Duminy, no run this could be a googly, beats Duminy's toe end as he looks to cut
Doherty to Miller, no run moves forward to defend this back to the bowler
Doherty to Miller, 1 run waits for this to turn in, dabs it slightly wide of point for one
Doherty to Duminy, no run tossed up outside off, comes down the track and kicks it away
Doherty to Duminy, 1 run flatter, he stays back, and places it wide of point
Doherty to Miller, no run length ball, on the pads, can't beat short fine leg

Doherty to Miller, no run Shaun George's first big decision in ODIs has been challenged. He has given Miller lbw. This is angled away, pitching appreciably outside off, then turns against the angle, seems to me to have hit him outside the line. George has given it, though. Hot Spot deliberates over an inside edge even before
Smith to Duminy, 1 run short, outside off, punched down the ground for one
Smith to Miller, no run short of a length, on off, defended back to the bowler
Smith to Miller, no run he is pressing forward, Smith is keeping them just short of driving length. Defended back
Smith to Miller, 1 run this is short and wide, muscled to long-off for one
Smith to Duminy, 1 run overpitched, on the pads, glanced away fine for a single
Smith to Miller, 1 run short, just outside off, cut away for a single
Cummins to Miller, 1 run length ball, on off, pushed with soft hands, gets a single before extra cover can intervene
Cummins to Duminy, no run length ball, just outside off, hits the inside half of the bat
Cummins to Duminy, no run pushed straight to straight midwicket, sent back
Cummins to Duminy, no run slower short ball, doesn't bouncer high, Duminy knows nothing about it and stands and watches helplessly
Cummins to Duminy, no run full, outside off, driven to mid-off
Cummins to Duminy, no run quick length ball, 144ks, no room, hits him high on the bat, comes back to him
Johnson to Miller, 3 wide and he bowls full and wide, well down the leg side, Haddin can't get there
Johnson to Miller, FOUR runs what a top shot, not so smart with the ball, though. He has a strong on-side field, and bowls a wide length ball. Smacked between cover and extra cover
Johnson to Miller, 1 run short of a length, outside off, punched to sweeper-cover for one
Johnson to Duminy, 1 run slower ball, 125ks, driven with an open face, hands over the strike
Johnson to Miller, FOUR runs Miller is hurting Australia here. Short of a length, outside off, and he delays the shot, and delicately opens the face to beat short third man
Johnson to Miller, 4 leg byes poor bowling, full, wide down the leg side, and had Miller's pads not deflected this, Haddin would have been tested to keep it under five wides
Johnson to Miller, 2 runs yorker, middle and leg, squeezes it square, past short fine, comes back for two
Cummins to Duminy, 4 leg byes another leg-side wide has been intercepted by the pads, but the deflection beats short fine leg to go to the fence
Cummins to Duminy, 1 run short of a length, on pads, nudged away to bring up the 200 in the 37th over, which on a dry turner is a threatening score
Cummins to Miller, FOUR runs Miller is playing a blinder here. Length ball, outside off, uses every yard of Cummins's pace to beat third man who is back but a touch too wide
Cummins to Miller, 2 runs slower short ball, pulled square of deep square, comes back for two. A happy Sunday afternoon crowd is loving this
Cummins to Miller, no run short of a length, not much room, can't beat point with this dab
Cummins to Miller, 1 run gets a bottom edge on this, the ball hasn't left the pitch, but Duminy calls him through for a stolen single
Johnson to Miller, no run length ball, middle and off, 139ks, no room, defended to cover
Johnson to Miller, 1 run length on off again, no room again, all he manages is a single to deep cover
Johnson to Duminy, no run short and wide, cut away, can't beat point

Johnson to Duminy, 1 run good delivery, though, short getting big on him, but Johnson has missed another run-out. Miller pushes for a single as this rolls to Haddin, but Johnson is not back to collect the throw. Duminy is still going to end up short as Johnson goes to his left to collect the underarm from Haddin. The momentum
Johnson to Miller, 1 run punched square for a single
Johnson to Duminy, no run tucks him up with a short ball, defended
Cummins to Miller, 1 run runs this behind square with an open face
Cummins to Duminy, 2 runs the open face again, this time sufficiently left of third man for them to come back for two
Cummins to Duminy, 1 run yorker on off, digs it out, moves softly towards mid-off, they have enough time to take the single

Cummins to Miller, no run slower bouncer, 118ks, Miller tries to pull twice I think but the ball doesn't arrive. He still has time to try to open the face, the ball hits the toe end, and bounces well short of Haddin
Cummins to Miller, no run driven, but straight to mid-off
Cummins to Miller, FOUR runs Miller restarts the boundary engine, charging at Cummins. Turns this into a length ball, and drives it through extra cover. Wide of sweeper-cover too
Johnson to Duminy, 1 run runs this down to third man, hands the strike over
Johnson to Miller, 1 run length, outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
Johnson to Duminy, 1 run short, outside off, doesn't bounce high, pulled away for a single
Johnson to Miller, no run short of a length, on off, no room, defended back to him
Johnson to Miller, no run nice yorker, swinging down the leg side, hits him on the toe, appeals for leg-before, but it is slipping down
Johnson to Miller, 1 run this is slightly fuller, and the low full toss has been clipped away square on the leg side
Bollinger to Miller, FOUR runs and he has been welcomed back with a thump of a pull. Just short of a length, not really sharp, and he muscles it through midwicket
Bollinger to Miller, 1 run short of a length, on the pads, worked away for a single
Bollinger to Duminy, no run looks to work this to leg, is early into the shot, hit on the pad
Bollinger to Duminy, no run length ball, middle and off, defended to mid-on
Bollinger to Duminy, 3 runs full toss on the pads, Smith misfields at long-on, allows two extra runs. Let the rants resume
Bollinger to Miller, no run full, on off, drives, can't beat mid-off
Smith to Duminy, 2 runs tossed up on off, leaves the crease, places this between deep midwicket and long-on, comes back for two. That's typical Duminy
Smith to Duminy, no run quick, on the pads, defended back to him
Smith to Duminy, 2 runs full toss, soft hands again, between deep midwicket and long-on, and they take Warner on to take the second
Smith to Duminy, 1 run floated across him, he opens the face to take a single
Smith to Miller, 1 run googly, too short, too wide, but cut away straight to the sweeper
Smith to Duminy, no run slower through the air, 85ks, outside off, driven straight to extra cover
Bollinger to Miller, no run short, into the body, beaten on the pull, hit on the thigh pad
Bollinger to Miller, 2 runs length ball, on off, driven wide of sweeper-cover for two runs
Bollinger to Miller, no run wide of the crease, angling in, hits the inside edge onto the pad
Bollinger to Miller, 1 run slower ball, on off, pushed to mid-off with soft hands, takes the single
Bollinger to Duminy, 1 run yorker, on the pads, deflects it behind square
Bollinger to Miller, 1 run full, on the pads, nicely clipped away for a single
Cummins to Miller, no run skiddy shortish delivery, pulled straight to midwicket
Cummins to Miller, 1 run length ball, on off, pushes forward, gets a inside edge to reach his second ODI fifty. Produces a huge applause from the crowd bathed in the sun
Cummins to Duminy, no run this is a grubber for a bouncer, barely bounces over the stumps, but more incredibly Duminy has ducked under it
Cummins to Duminy, no run slower ball, looks to cut it, gets an inside edge, and Haddin dives to his right to save a few here

Cummins to Duminy, FOUR runs no one is going to save this edge from going for four. He looks to go inside-out with this length ball, gets a thick edge, and it flies well fine of third man for Duminy's first four
Cummins to Duminy, FOUR runs the extra slow bouncer, outside leg, would have been a wide had he not got enough bat on it to beat Haddin and short fine leg
Bollinger to Miller, no run hit straight to midwicket
Bollinger to Miller, no run a near yorker, makes room and drives, but can't beat extra cover
Bollinger to Miller, FOUR runs short of a length, middle and off, nips in a touch, Miller gets an inside edge, beating the keeper who dives to his right
Bollinger to Miller, 1 run full, on the pads, Bollinger is lucky Miller has found short fine leg with this deflection
Bollinger to Duminy, 1 run pulled away nicely, gets a single to deep square
Bollinger to Miller, 2 runs full toss on leg, makes room and drives it past point, to the right of deep cover
Johnson to Duminy, no run short, not too wide, the cut finds point
Johnson to Duminy, 2 runs pulled away, substitute Mitch Marsh fumbles at deep square to allow the second
Johnson to Duminy, 1 run pushed down the ground for a single
Johnson to Miller, 1 run makes room to smash it, mis-hits to midwicket for a risky single, but Smith doesn't collect it cleanly there
Johnson to Duminy, 1 run short of a length, outside off, runs it down to third man
Johnson to Miller, 1 run well bowled, Miller is making room, looking for any sort of lenght to get under. Johnson stays in the block hole, all Miller can do is squeeze it out for a single

Cummins to Miller, OUT and strikes right away. Miller is gone after playing a forceful, momentum-grabbing innings. He backs away, trying to hit it over the off side, the ball is short of a length, and angles away. A thick edge is taken, and settles with Haddin
Cummins to Boucher, 2 runs short of a length, flicked away to the left of fine leg for a couple
Cummins to Boucher, 1 leg bye length ball, angling down the leg side, concedes a leg-bye
Cummins to Duminy, 2 runs punched on the walk, wide of sweeper-cover, comes back for an easy two
Cummins to Duminy, 1 run short of a length, middle and leg, drops and runs, takes a single
Cummins to Boucher, 1 run full, just outside off, takes a risky single to cover, and this time Clarke himself fumbles
Bollinger to Boucher, 1 run yorker outside off, digs it out for one. Over to JP
Bollinger to Duminy, 1 run bouncer, pulls this down the ground, gets just the single to long-on
Bollinger to Boucher, no run length ball, outside off, goes across the line, hits it back to Bollinger
Bollinger to Boucher, 1 run across the line again, although this time he makes good connection. Bounces short of long-on
Bollinger to Duminy, 1 run low full toss, no room, driven to sweeper-cover for one
Bollinger to Boucher, 1 wide sees him charging at him, Bollinger bowls full and wide outside off, but it is called a wide

Bollinger to Boucher, FOUR runs this time Boucher goes with the angle and down the ground, and benefits. This is a length ball outside off, he drives it on the up, along the ground, and between Bollinger and mid-off. So that wide ends up costing them five

Cummins to Duminy, SIX runs Fast bowlers don't like it, but this happens more often to them nowadays. Slower ball on a length, middle and off, Duminy clears the front leg, and lofts him straight into the sight screen
Cummins to Duminy, 1 run clears the front leg and swipes again, but this time he can't beat mid-off
Cummins to Boucher, 1 run yorker, digs it out to mid-off, takes the single
Cummins to Duminy, 1 wide slower ball gone wrong, big wide down the leg side
Cummins to Duminy, 1 run has to reach for this after he backs away with the front leg, ends up hitting it to mid-off for one
Cummins to Boucher, 1 run Boucher makes room, this slower ball is outside off, but not too wide, so Boucher has to reach at it, and ends up slogging it down to long-on for one

Cummins to Duminy, SIX runs He has found the roof of St George's Park. That landed on tin with a loud thud. Length ball from Cummins, 137ks, Duminy clears the front leg, and lofts it straight over his head. What clean sensible striking here. reaches fifty too
Bollinger to Boucher, 1 run Boucher charges at Bollinger, hits him to long-on to bring Duminy back on
Bollinger to Duminy, 2 runs yorker, middle and leg, squeezed out to long-on, and they are lightning quick to take the second to bring up the 300. The crowd has gone berserk

Bollinger to Duminy, OUT he has hit the full toss straight down Smith's throat at midwicket. Smith doesn't realise it is a catch, and wants to throw at the non-striker's end. He has a surprised look on his face as neither the non-striker wants to run nor the bowler wants the throw. I think Smith was ready in case it is called
Bollinger to Botha, 1 run slower ball, short of a length, takes a single to mid-off
Bollinger to Boucher, 1 run slog to midwicket, would have been run out had Clarke hit, but he has missed by a long way
Bollinger to Botha, 1 run slogged away on the leg side, along the ground, for a single

Four fifties for South Africa, and 303 looks like a really good total on what is a dry pitch. Australia looked a bit rattled in the field, but they have the batting fire power to chase down totals. I am not sure if Watson will be allowed to open, or bat with a runner. I am not sure Australia will want to risk a major injury just for
Steyn to Warner, 2 runs length ball, on off, crisply push-driven, past cover, gets a couple
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs short of a length, on the pads, gently nudged away, but superbly timed, square of fine leg
Steyn to Warner, no run outswinger, 138ks, on off, pushed back to Steyn, who wants to have a mock throw, but doesn't field cleanly
Steyn to Warner, no run slower ball, 125ks, on leg, Warner checks the shot, and defends to midwicket
Steyn to Warner, no run length ball, on off, stays on the crease, defends
Steyn to Warner, no run another slower ball, 122ks, closes the face on this, but can't beat the diving square leg
Tsotsobe to Ponting, no run short of a length, angled across, stays low, squeezes under the bat
Tsotsobe to Ponting, no run gets behind the line this time, punches it to cover
Tsotsobe to Ponting, FOUR runs short at 128ks. Ponting of the old would have sent this into the Indian Ocean. Ponting of the new pulls it over midwicket for four
Tsotsobe to Ponting, 1 run short of a length, punched away square past point
Tsotsobe to Warner, 1 run full, on the pads, clipped away for a single

Tsotsobe to Ponting, FOUR runs lovely straight punch. Ponting looks threatening. Gets the big stride in, meets this length under his eye, and push-drives it to the left of the bowler and right of mid-off
Steyn to Warner, no run crisply driven square, but can't beat Duminy at point
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs slower ball, 122ks, still it flies off the bat. He just meets it with an open face, and extreme speed has been generated on the ball. It goes between cover and extra cover
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs Pummelled. Brutal. This fast and short, and Warner loves them. It comes at 145ks, and is pulled at an immeasurably quicker pace
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs slower ball, he is early into the shot, but manages to get it over point. Tsotsobe runs around from third man and puts the dive in, but can't stop four
Steyn to Warner, no run slower ball again, 123ks, hit to short cover this time
Steyn to Warner, no run Warner shapes up for the pull, but decides this is slightly too full for the pull. Punches this to mid-on
Tsotsobe to Ponting, 1 run length ball, pushed to mid-off with soft hands
Tsotsobe to Warner, FOUR runs Does this bat have springs? He leans into this length ball and defends with an open face. And it goes blazing across between cover and cover-point
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run this time he defends to point
Tsotsobe to Warner, 1 run full, on the pads, driven wide of mid-on for one

Tsotsobe to Ponting, OUT du Plessis is claiming a low catch at cover-point. Ponting is not moving. This is short, angling away, game for cut, but the tennis-ball bounce means it comes slower and higher. Ponting ends up hitting uppishly and in front of square. Replays show he has been taken. Clean as a whistel, low in front of
Tsotsobe to Clarke, no run shortish outside off, skids through low, Clarke is beaten on the cut
Morkel to Warner, no run digs this one in, the ball doesn't come on, defended
Morkel to Warner, 1 run pushed wide of mid-on for one
Morkel to Clarke, no run dangerous leave, on height as much as line. Short of a length, close to off, Clarke shoulders arms. The balls stays low, and nips back in. Misses the stumps
Morkel to Clarke, 1 leg bye short again, worked away off the hip for a single
Morkel to Warner, no run length ball, crisply driven down the ground, but you can't escape the long limbs of Morne
Morkel to Warner, no run another length ball, sharp at 144ks, hit to mid-on, off the inside half of the bat
Tsotsobe to Clarke, no run short of a length, around off, pushed to cover
Tsotsobe to Clarke, 1 run not in control of this pull shot, but manages to hit it wide of mid-on
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run slower ball, 122ks, short of a length, on off, defended to short cover
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run some late swing there, nearly beats the inside edge, but it is that very edge that saves him from an lbw call
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run half-volley on off, drilled down the ground, can't beat mid-off
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run short of a length, no room, defended to cover

Morkel to Clarke, OUT Morne Morkel bowls a beauty. They say hit the top of off, Morne bowls just by top of off. You can't do much more than defend these balls. Clarke plays for the angle, but misjudges the angle and gets the edge. Graeme Smith's bucket hands at first slip do the rest
Morkel to Hussey, no run length ball, on off, defended back to the bowler
Morkel to Hussey, no run length, just outside off, left alone
Morkel to Hussey, no run on the pads, worked away, but not past square leg
Morkel to Hussey, no run short of a length, middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
Morkel to Hussey, no run good bouncer, 140ks, around middle and off, seams away a touch, Hussey shapes up for the pull, and then pulls out

Tsotsobe to Warner, no run Reviewed. Boucher has initiated this. And this seems like a good call to me. I heard a woody sound as the ball passed down the leg sound. Boucher heard that too, and convinced Amla to go for it. Replays, though, show it hit the pad, and was nowhere near the bat. However, the sound was woody
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run short of a length, outside off, punched square to point
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run length ball, outside off, pushed back to Tsotsobe

Tsotsobe to Warner, 1 run slower ball, nearly caught. Warner attacks it, hits uppishly towards mid-on, Amla takes a couple of steps in, but it bounces well in front of him. However, he manages to get his sliding body behind it, and concedes just one
Tsotsobe to Hussey, 1 run cut away hard, falls a few yards short of third man
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run length ball outside off, driven powerfully, to mid-off
Morkel to Hussey, no run mistimes a pull from outside off
Morkel to Hussey, no run short of a length, around off, left alone
Morkel to Hussey, FOUR runs the rare loose ball from Morne, a wide half-volley, and Hussey deals with it with a square drive, to the right of cover
Morkel to Hussey, no run this is real full, near-yorker, dug out to mid-on
Morkel to Hussey, no run short of a length, on off, pushed to cover
Morkel to Hussey, no run length ball, on off, pushed to cover, belts out a call of no
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run Dropped. A sitter too. Slower ball again, hit loopily to Amal at mid-on. Chest-high. He grabs at in front of his body. Spilled. Lonwabo can't even swear. It's the captain
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run length ball, punched to cover
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run anther length ball, no room, pushed back to Tsotsobe
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run short of a length, punched down to mid-off
Tsotsobe to Warner, no run another slower ball driven uppishly, this falls well short of mid-off
Tsotsobe to Warner, 1 run driven to midwicket, through his legs it goes. Been an over of sloppy fielding
Morkel to Warner, 1 leg bye that
Morkel to Hussey, no run length ball, on off, driven with open face, straight to cover-point

Morkel to Hussey, FOUR runs lovely shot, he has been hitting straight to cover, but this time he waits an extra half second to make sure he beats the man to his right. It was a wide ball asking for it
Morkel to Hussey, no run on a length, on off, pushed with an open face
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run bouncer, quick one, Hussey goes for the pull, mis-hits it down towards square leg

Morkel to Warner, no run that's strange. I don't think I have ever seen this happen before. Bouncer down the leg side. Looks like a wide, but Warner pulls. Hits the back of the bat, lobs, and falls well short of slip
Botha to Hussey, no run no turn on the first ball, beats the inside edge, belts out an appeal. Even Boucher is not interested as this is going down leg
Botha to Hussey, no run quick, on off, pushed to cover
Botha to Hussey, no run slows this one down, tosses it up, gets bug turn from outside off, beats the outside edge this time
Botha to Hussey, 1 run slow again, but short, punched square for a single
Botha to Warner, 1 run short again, punched to sweeper-cover for one
Botha to Hussey, no run flighted on middle and off, Hussey pushes forward and defends
Kallis to Warner, no run short of a length, middle and off, hit back to Kallis
Kallis to Warner, no run fuller, outside off, stays low, beats the drive
Kallis to Warner, no run slower ball, 112ks, vicious offcutter it is, beats the outside edge, falls in front of Boucher
Kallis to Warner, no run bouncer now, 143ks, over the stumps, sways out of the line
Kallis to Warner, 1 run slower ball again, 118ks, punched to long-off for one
Kallis to Hussey, 1 run short, no sting in this, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
Botha to Hussey, no run short of a length, punched powerfully to his right, but he flies across to save one run
Botha to Hussey, no run this one stops and goes with the arm, hit uppishly back to Botha
Botha to Hussey, 1 run flat, outside off, cut away to sweeper-cover
Botha to Warner, no run slightly short of a length, tries to cut, finds Amla at point, which means the skipper has moved out of slip. It's Kallis now at slip
Botha to Warner, 1 run cut away to deep backward point for one
Botha to Hussey, no run the arm ball, nearly gets his man, but the inside edge saves him
Kallis to Warner, 1 run short, skids onto him, pulled to long-on for one
Kallis to Hussey, no run length, on the pads, pushed back to Kallis
Kallis to Hussey, no run slower ball, full, driven to cover, and du Plessis gives Warner a scare with quick work. Warner, who has merely backed up, has to dive back
Kallis to Hussey, no run more good work in the field. This time it's Duminy diving full length to his right at backward point. That's four saved because it was cut powerfully
Kallis to Hussey, no run slower ball, 118ks, tries to open the face, finds point
Kallis to Hussey, 1 run this is quick, and he has run this down to third man for one
Botha to Hussey, no run arm ball again, on off, angling in, defended off the back foot
Botha to Hussey, no run missed stumping. Sees him come down, fires it into the pads at 91ks, the ball squeezes between Hussey and leg stump, but it's too quick for Bouhcer, who is hit on the pad
Botha to Hussey, 1 run pushed to long-on for one
Botha to Warner, FOUR runs Warner finally hits another boundary, slog-sweeping this full ball over midwicket
Botha to Warner, no run the arm ball again, betas the inside edge but it is going to miss leg
Botha to Warner, 1 run short ball, pulled away to deep square
Kallis to Warner, 1 run full on off, thick edge goes away to third man
Kallis to Hussey, no run short, skids onto him, the pull goes to mid-on
Kallis to Hussey, 1 run slower ball, on middle and leg, opens the face, takes the single
Kallis to Warner, no run slower ball, 120ks, Warner wants to pull, but it isn't short enough, and he ends up hitting back to the bowler
Kallis to Warner, no run slower ball again, 118ks, no room, pitches leg, cuts towards off, pushed to midwicket
Kallis to Warner, 2 runs slow again, 113ks, pulled away wide of long-on for two
Steyn to Hussey, no run deflects this leg-side length ball to short fine. Straight to Kallis. Sent back by Warner
Steyn to Hussey, no run opens the face on this length ball, can't beat point
Steyn to Hussey, no run bouncer, 134ks, Hussey is early into the pull, and is hit in the chest area
Steyn to Hussey, 1 run comes down the track, Steyn bowls the slower one, 117ks, pushed softly to mid-off for a single
Steyn to Warner, 1 run slower ball again, 118ks, pushed wide of Styen. His dive can't prevent a single
Steyn to Hussey, 1 leg bye slower ball again, on a length, on the pads, concedes a leg-bye
Kallis to Hussey, FOUR runs short-arm pull, crisp crunchy connection, over midwicket. After overs of trying to pull he finally gets one that is short enough, and lays into it
Kallis to Hussey, FOUR runs lovely late-cut. This is not to short, but he leans back and sends it crashing to the right of point and left of third man
Kallis to Hussey, no run slower ball now, fuller too, no room, defended to cover
Kallis to Hussey, 1 run nudged away off the pads for a single
Kallis to Warner, no run looks to pull this but it skids on, hits the bottom edge
Kallis to Warner, 1 run slower ball again, punched to cover for one
Steyn to Warner, 3 runs length ball on the pads, nicely flicked away behind square, Tahir is in the game immediately, makes a diving save
Steyn to Hussey, no run length ball on off, punched off the front foot
Steyn to Hussey, 1 run another slower ball, tries to drive, hits the inside half of the bat
Steyn to Warner, no run full on middle and off, drilled to mid-off
Steyn to Warner, no run slower ball, on off, pushed to cover
Steyn to Warner, 1 run Steyn is bowling only slower balls here, this one is driven to long-off for one
Kallis to Warner, 1 run slower ball, on off, pushed to mid-off for one
Kallis to Hussey, no run bouncer, sharp, although the gun says 135ks, head-high, left alone
Kallis to Hussey, 1 run pushes to mid-off, soft hands, runs, charges, dives for a single
Kallis to Warner, 1 run on the pads, worked away for an easy single
Kallis to Hussey, 1 run slower ball, pushed to mid-off for one
Kallis to Warner, 1 run soft hands again, pushed just wide of Kallis and they steal a single
Duminy to Warner, 1 run flat lenght ball, cut away, Morne's long diving limbs at backward point save three runs
Duminy to Hussey, 1 run pushed wide of midwicket for one
Duminy to Warner, 1 run driven to long-off to bring up his fifty. It has been a responsible innings after that big fiery start. A quiet applause, and a quiet reception
Duminy to Hussey, 1 run opens the face, past point, gets a single
Duminy to Warner, no run driven back to the bowler
Duminy to Warner, no run arm ball, gets the inside edge onto the pad
Botha to Hussey, 1 run flighted outside off, pushed to sweeper-cover for one
Botha to Warner, no run flighted around off again, Warner goes for the big cover drive, beaten by the turn
Botha to Warner, 1 run driven to the right of cover, take the single despite the dive
Botha to Hussey, 1 run pushed into the vacant midwicket region for one
Botha to Warner, 1 run late-cuts this, du Plessis is on the ball, saves three with a full-length dive at cover-point
Botha to Hussey, 1 run pushed to the left of cover for one
Duminy to Hussey, 1 run flat, into middle and leg, pushed towards midwicket for one
Duminy to Warner, no run arm ball, quicker, takes the bottom edge
Duminy to Warner, no run hits this into his own pad
Duminy to Warner, 1 run tries the big sweep this time, inside edge goes for a single to deep square
Duminy to Hussey, no run flighted on middle and leg, defended
Duminy to Hussey, 1 run short of a length, punched to deep point for one
Botha to Hussey, no run short of a length, stays low, hit to cover

Botha to Hussey, no run that's a second stumping missed by Boucher. In fact it is an action replay of the earlier one. Hussey leaves the crease, the full ball passes between Hussey and the stumps. Boucher doesn't gather it. Missed on 18 and 36. Watch out when he is 54
Botha to Hussey, 1 run pushed past midwicket for one
Botha to Warner, 2 runs full, angling in, pushed wide of deep square, and they pinch the second
Botha to Warner, no run slower through the air, on middle and off, defended to cover
Botha to Warner, 1 run shortish, turns away after pitching off, turned into the on side for a single
Duminy to Warner, no run that's a grubber. Seems like a long hop. Warner wants to pull, but that has gone shin high to Boucher
Duminy to Warner, no run fired in full and straight, pushed back to Duminy
Duminy to Warner, no run flighted outside off, driven to the right of cover where du Plessis makes a diving save
Duminy to Warner, 1 run driven to sweeper-cover for one

Duminy to Hussey, OUT Hussey is gone. He has run himself out. Botha has had Hussey missed twice off his bowling, but this time his rocket arm gets rid of the man. Deflected fine off the pads, Hussey wants one, rightly sent back, and even though he has taken about four steps down the wicket, he can't make it bat. Comprehensive
Duminy to Smith, no run fired across him, outside off, defended to leg
Botha to Warner, 1 run flighted outside off, pushed to cover for one
Botha to Smith, 1 run pushed square on the off side to get off the mark. Only 147 more, Steve
Botha to Warner, 1 run fired into the pads, pushed wide of midwicket
Botha to Smith, no run topspinner, middle and off, defended to leg
Botha to Smith, 1 run flighted outside off, driven to long-on for one
Botha to Warner, 1 run length ball on off, driven down to long-off for one
Duminy to Warner, 2 runs cut away in front of square, to the left of sweeper-cover for two
Duminy to Warner, 1 run worked to the right of short fine for one
Duminy to Smith, no run full, on off, driven back to the bowler
Duminy to Smith, 1 leg bye worked away off the pads, around the corner
Duminy to Warner, no run length ball outside off, pushed tom cover, du Plessis doesn't allow anything there
Duminy to Warner, 1 run this is angled into the pads, pushed wide of midwicket for one
Botha to Warner, no run slower through the air, gets turn from just outside off, beats the edge
Botha to Warner, 2 runs full, fired into the pads, Warner's bat comes down just in time, wide of deep midwicket, comes back for two
Botha to Warner, no run length ball on off, straighten, pushed with an open face
Botha to Warner, 1 run driven wide of cover for a single
Botha to Smith, 1 run turns in towards the pad,s worked away for a single

Botha to Warner, no run Botha belts out a big appeal after bowling the one that goes straight with the arm. The bat and pad are close together, there is bat involved for sure, but Botha appeals for pad first. Umpire George doesn't think so
Morkel to Smith, no run starts off with a full ball outside off, defended to cover
Morkel to Smith, no run that's a beaut from Morkel. Short of a length, outside off, holds its line, beats the edge, bounces in front of Boucher
Morkel to Smith, no run Beaten again. This one holds its line again, Smith pushes at it. Makes no connection. Again bounces in front of Smith
Morkel to Smith, no run half-forward to defend this time, to cover
Morkel to Smith, 1 run breaks the maiden by pushing this lenght ball to the left of cover
Morkel to Warner, 2 runs length ball, thumped on the up, between long-on and long-off, gets a couple
Botha to Smith, 1 run straighter one outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
Botha to Warner, 2 runs angling into the pads, played with soft hands, just a nudge into the on side, where all men are at the fence. Makes an easy couple to reach his ODI best
Botha to Warner, 1 run this is angled in again, but has been pushed firmly and will bring him just the one
Botha to Smith, no run flighted on middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
Botha to Smith, no run this one dips slightly on him, pushed to midwicket again
Botha to Smith, 1 run short of a length, goes with the arm, flicked from outside off for a single
Morkel to Smith, 1 run short of a length, punched away to deep cover for one

Morkel to Warner, 2 runs slightly short, pulled wide of long-on, where Amla fields. They take the second, Morkel is not quite by the stumps to collect the throw. Would have been very close had he done so

Morkel to Warner, OUT just too much pressure of the asking rate I suppose. And Morkel is not the bowler you can have your way with. This time the bounce gets a touch big, Warner's pull generates a hefty top edge, Boucher goes back towards short fine leg, and catches this swirling ball over his shoulder. Had to drag this pull
Morkel to Smith, no run short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
Morkel to Smith, 1 run short, this is not nasty, and is pulled away to deep square for one
Morkel to Watson, no run gets a full ball, which he drives back to Morkel, who has a mock throw at him
Steyn to Smith, 2 runs nicely opens the face on this quick length ball, to the left of third man
Steyn to Smith, no run powerfully punched away, du Plessis dives at backward point, to take his fielding score into the double figures
Steyn to Smith, no run this one stays a touch low, keeps it out, another dot
Steyn to Smith, 1 run slower ball, steered away to third man for one
Steyn to Watson, no run straight, length, no room, defended back to Steyn
Steyn to Watson, no run looks to run this behind square, can't beat point
Kallis to Smith, 2 runs slower ball on off, worked square on the on side with soft hands, comes back for two
Kallis to Smith, 1 run slow again, on off, this time he gets just the single to short fine
Kallis to Watson, SIX runs Beware the wounded batsman lads. Kallis digs this in short, never mind that Watson is forward, he clubs this for a flat six over square leg
Kallis to Watson, FOUR runs Slower ball, Watson sees it early, Watson plants the big front foot down, and slogs this over midwicket. Now fun is coming
Kallis to Watson, 1 run slower ball, but too full to get under, so he drives it along the ground to long-on
Kallis to Smith, no run makes room to drive this square, can't beat backward point
Steyn to Watson, 2 runs Watson continues to look threatening, pulls this to cow corner. Duminy from long-on has to give it a big chase and a final lunge to keep them down to two
Steyn to Watson, 1 run gets the yorker right this time, just the single
Steyn to Smith, 1 run slower ball, Smith does the thing to do, push it to long-on and hand it over to Watson
Steyn to Watson, 1 run watches Watson back away, follows him with a slower one, Watson flicks it to leg
Steyn to Smith, no run short of a length, on off, no room, hit back to Steyn
Steyn to Smith, no run sees him back away, and slips in one wide of off. Beats a desperate attempt to get bat on it

Tsotsobe to Watson, OUT and on cue Tsotsobe strikes, and that's the game. Slower ball, 118ks, on a length, middle and leg, Watson clears the front leg to go over cow corner, is early into the shot, and ends up dragging it straight to deep square. They all surround Lopsy
Tsotsobe to Smith, 1 run another slower ball, 116ks, hit uppishly, to the right of straight extra cover
Tsotsobe to Haddin, 1 run pushed wide of mid-off for one
Tsotsobe to Smith, 1 run slower ball, opens the face, gets a single
Tsotsobe to Haddin, 1 run driven down to long-off for one
Tsotsobe to Smith, 1 run slower ball on the pads, worked around the corner for one
Steyn to Smith, 1 run slow again, opens the face, gets a single to the left of backward point
Steyn to Haddin, 1 run length ball, quick, pushed to extra cover, and they scramble a single
Steyn to Smith, 1 run outswinger at 143ks, that's the quickest Steyn has bowled tonight, steered to third man for one
Steyn to Haddin, no run slower ball, full, driven to cover-point
Steyn to Haddin, 1 run stays back, pushes wide of cover, takes a single
Steyn to Smith, 2 runs skier, top-edges this as he looks to slog, but it falls wide of deep midwicket
Tsotsobe to Haddin, 1 run lofted straight, but can't beat long-on
Tsotsobe to Smith, 1 run length ball, middle and off, pushed wide of cover for one
Tsotsobe to Haddin, 1 bye slower ball, a grubber, bounces well short of Boucher. They take a bye off the ricochet

Tsotsobe to Smith, 3 runs for an agonising little moment it seemed Smith had hit hi first boundary by walking across and flicking this past short fine. Botha, though, from deep square gives it a big chase, and throws itself at it to save one run
Tsotsobe to Haddin, 1 run this one stops at him, driven uppishly to mid-off
Tsotsobe to Smith, no run slower offcutter, beats Smith as he backs away to try and hit it over cover
Morkel to Haddin, no run lovely bowling. Short of a length, angling in, leaving him upon pitching, beating the outside edge
Morkel to Haddin, no run short of a length again, hitting the shoulder of the bat as he defends
Morkel to Haddin, no run makes room to try to slash over point, beaten by extra bounce
Morkel to Haddin, 1 run short of a length, on off, tips and runs
Morkel to Haddin, no run length ball, on off, pushed to the bowler
Tsotsobe to Johnson, no run Johnson shoulders arms to the first ball he faces
Tsotsobe to Johnson, no run slower offcutter, beats the bat outside off
Tsotsobe to Johnson, no run length ball on off, defended to leg
Tsotsobe to Johnson, 1 run another length ball, driven to long-on for one
Tsotsobe to Haddin, no run can't beat midwicket with this flick
Tsotsobe to Haddin, no run uppishly driven as this stops at him, but it falls short of extra cover
Morkel to Johnson, no run short of a length, angling across, beats the edge
Morkel to Johnson, no run short of a length, on the stumps, ribs area, defended back to him
Morkel to Johnson, no run length ball, on off, defended towards mid-off
Morkel to Johnson, no run slower ball, passes under the pull shot
Morkel to Johnson, no run short of a length, on off, defended
Morkel to Johnson, no run that's a second maiden from Morne as Johnson displays some more correct back-and-across defence
Botha to Haddin, 1 run flighted on off, pushed into the covers
Botha to Johnson, no run offbreak, starts outside off, defended to cover
Botha to Johnson, no run Johnson gives him the charge, Botha fires in a quick delivery, hits his pad
Botha to Johnson, FOUR runs finally Johnson hits, into the cow corner, gets four
Botha to Johnson, no run Johnson tries the reverse sweep, takes one in the ribs
Botha to Johnson, no run sees him come down, and fires in a yorker
Kallis to Haddin, 1 run length ball, middle and leg, pushed past midwicket for one
Kallis to Johnson, no run slower ball, on leg, tries to force this square, can't beat point
Kallis to Johnson, 1 wide wide down the leg side
Kallis to Johnson, 1 run short of a length, punched to long-on for one
Kallis to Haddin, 1 run slower ball, drags this across to leg for a single
Kallis to Johnson, no run slower ball beats the attempt to drive it through cover
Kallis to Johnson, 1 run pushed wide of cover for a single
Botha to Johnson, no run arm ball, on off, Johnson punches it to cover
Botha to Johnson, 1 run overpitched, driven to long-on for one
Botha to Haddin, 1 run Haddin lofts this down the ground, on a bounce to long-on
Botha to Johnson, 1 run gives him the charge to drive this to deep midwicket for one
Botha to Haddin, 1 run full, on the pads, hit to midwicket, takes a single off the fumble
Morkel to Haddin, no run nicely cut away upon making room, can't beat point
Morkel to Haddin, 1 run slower short ball, follows him, pulled away along the ground for one
Morkel to Doherty, no run gets an inside edge on the drive, but it falls short
Morkel to Doherty, no run short of a length, quick, hits his thigh pad
Morkel to Doherty, no run slower short ball, gets a bottom edge onto his pad
Morkel to Doherty, no run Doherty follows a length ball angling across him, fails to edge it
Steyn to Bollinger, FOUR runs Bollinger has a go at a length ball and edges it wide of the diving Kallis at first slip
Steyn to Bollinger, no run pushes tentatively at one outside off, beaten
Steyn to Bollinger, 1 run slower ball on off, pushed to cover for one
Steyn to Doherty, no run quick, on off, defended to cover
Steyn to Doherty, 1 run length ball, angling across, pushed wide of point
Morkel to Doherty, no run length ball on off, driven to extra cover
Morkel to Doherty, no run length ball, on off, pushed to cover
Morkel to Doherty, 1 run driven to long-on for one
Morkel to Bollinger, 1 run backs away to pull, Morne follows him, cramps him up, the mis-hit gets them a single
Morkel to Doherty, 1 run slower ball on off, pushes it to point for one, du Plessis tries the Rhodes-style run-out. Misses
Steyn to Doherty, no run stays low, bounces well short of Boucher. Has been a tough night for the keepers
Steyn to Doherty, no run slower length ball on the pads, defended to mid-off
Steyn to Doherty, 1 run driven to sweeper-cover for one
Steyn to Cummins, 1 wide slips down the leg side for a wide
Steyn to Cummins, no run length ball on off, pushed to cover
Steyn to Cummins, 2 runs off the short run, pushed to extra cover. That's first ODI run for Pat. And he gets an overthrow too. Life is easy
Steyn to Cummins, 1 run on the pad, helped away for a single
Duminy to Cummins, 1 run length ball, on the pads, worked away for a single
Duminy to Doherty, 2 runs full toss, laboriously hit over the head of short midwicket
Duminy to Doherty, 4 byes one more through Boucher, and it has mostly been the really full balls from the spinner, when the bat comes down at the same time as it pitches
Duminy to Doherty, 2 runs nicely driven inside-out, wide of long-off
Duminy to Doherty, 2 runs slower through the air, tries to late-cut it, but it follows him, and he bottom-edges it between his legs
Duminy to Doherty, no run tries to make room and hit, but misses
Steyn to Cummins, 2 runs steered away from just outside off to Smith at third man, which is good new sin itself. He was off the field earlier with a stomach bug
Steyn to Cummins, no run beaten outside off
Steyn to Cummins, FOUR runs Lovely strike from Cummins for his first ODI boundary. It's a half-volley, driven between mid-off and extra cover
Steyn to Cummins, 1 run bouncer, doesn't rise up, pulled away to deep square for one
Steyn to Doherty, no run length ball, outside off, pushed to cover

Steyn to Doherty, OUT Bowled out off the last ball. Full toss outside off, drives with an open face, Duminy catches it at point, and hands it over to the leg umpire, who at the moment is at point because the left-hand batsman is on strike. Doherty's average takes a blow, he had a great chance of ending not-out

A comprehensive win for South Africa. Fireworks go around at St George's Park. SA batted really well on this slow track, with fur men getting fifties. With Watson injured and two early wickets, it was always going to be tough. Hussey and Warner fought, but once they went it was all over, even though the inured Watson came out and hi
Time for the presentation
That's all we have tonight. Thanks for joining us, thanks for writing in. Cheers
South Africa won by 80 runs
Player of the match is Morne Morkel, SA
